In order to study the relationship between drinking alcohol and hypertension, a case-control study was conducted in 1992 by the Epidemiology Department of Shandong Medical University on the basis of community-based population screening, in which 154 new cases of hypertension were randomly selected as a case group and 583 normal people as a control group. The past alcohol consumption of the study subjects was investigated, along with variables such as age, sex, and body mass index (BMI>24 as overweight). Considering that body mass index may be a potential confounder when analysing the relationship between drinking alcohol and hypertension, it needs to be analysed and judged. The following table presents unstratified information on the relationship between the drinking alcohol and hypertensive disorders. <image 1> The cOR between the drinking alcohol and hypertensive is

A. 1.70
B. 2.50
C. 3.20
D. 4.80

To determine the correlation between drinking alcohol and hypertension, we need to calculate the odds ratio (OR) from the given data. The odds ratio compares the odds of having hypertension in the group that drinks alcohol to the odds of having hypertension in the group that does not drink alcohol.

The formula for the odds ratio is:
\[ OR = \frac{(\text{Cases who drink alcohol and have hypertension}) \times (\text{Controls who do not drink alcohol and have hypertension})}{(\text{Cases who drink alcohol and do not have hypertension}) \times (\text{Controls who do not drink alcohol and do not have hypertension})} \]

From the table:
- Cases who drink alcohol and have hypertension: 73
- Cases who drink alcohol and do not have hypertension: 81
- Controls who do not drink alcohol and have hypertension: 202
- Controls who do not drink alcohol and do not have hypertension: 381

Plugging these values into the formula:
\[ OR = \frac{73 \times 202}{81 \times 381} \]

Calculating the values:
\[ OR = \frac{14916}{31111} \approx 4.80 \]

So, the correlation between drinking alcohol and hypertension is approximately 4.80.

The correct answer is:
D. 4.80
